EdLUG Talk - An Introduction to OpenID

November 03, 2007

On Thursday 01 November I gave a brief talk titled “An Introduction to OpenID” at the monthly EdLUG meeting.Â  The slides for the talk are available on Slideshare.Â  It seemed to go well despite my fear of public speaking.Â  A few questions were put to me; some of which I could answer.

The few I couldn’t answer were mainly regarding the specifics of the OpenID authentication process.Â  Perhaps it was nerves, but in hindsight I realise I knew the answer all along.Â  I was asked if OpenID could tie into Kerberos or PAM.Â  This is really down to how one chooses to implement the standard.

The OpenID specifications state that at at some point authentication must be performed with the Identity Provider.Â  However, the details of how this authentication must be performed are purposefully not specified and instead left up to the implementor.Â  So in answer to the questions, yes you can use Kerberos or PAM in the authentication process, but it’s up toÂ  you to tie it all together.Â  In fact, traditional username/password combinations need not be used.Â  If one so chooses secure fobs or biometrics could indeed be used; it’s up to you!

New Job With Valley Technology

October 27, 2007

It’s official; on Thursday 01 November, I will start my new job with Edinburgh based Valley Technology.Â  Unfortunately that means saying goodbye to my friends at the Crown Office but with any luck I’ll still see them now and again.Â  And talk about jumping in at the deep end… on my first day I’ll be giving a brief five minute talk on OpenID at the EdLUG meeting that evening.Â  As crazy as it sounds I’m doing it mainly for my self-confidence; I’ve never been a fan of public speaking but with any luck this will help me improve.Â  I’ll post the slides up when I’m done.

About Me

I'm an Edinburgh based PHP developer with a passion for open source software and open-data, currently working for Maglabs. Living with my wife Jo and our two cats, Ziggy and Maggie.
